newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - APRIL 25.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - APRIL 25.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- Only one trade union of railway workers support the idea of a strike of the national railway company MAV's employees and that diminishes the chance of a strike.
- Prime Minister Gyula Horn said that problems in the agricultural sector can be resolved only by cooperation embracing the whole nation.

- Hungarian police were said to have contacted four mafia groups in an effort to find the car of the body guards of Croatian President Franjo Tudjman. The car was stolen one week ago, before Tudjman's official visit to Budapest.
- Frequent thefts will force the railway company MAV to replace copper wires to signal lights at railway crossings with aluminium wires.
